briefdescription.para: list of image files and labels

memberdef.argsstring: (const int width=0, const int height=0, const int num_ch=0, const int num_labels=0)
memberdef.name: set_input_params

detaileddescription.para: Set up imagenet specific input parameters If argument is set to 0, then this method does not change the value of the corresponding parameter. However, width and height can only be both zero or both non-zero.

Load the dataset. Each data reader implementation should implement this to initialize its internal data structures, determine the number of samples and their dimensionality (if needed), and set up and shuffle samples.

briefdescription.para: Return the number of labels (classes) in this dataset.
Get the total number of channel values in a sample of image(s).
Get the linearized size (i.e. number of elements) in a label.
Get the dimensions of the data.

memberdef.argsstring: (Mat &pixels, const std::string filename, bool do_scale=true) override
memberdef.name: save_image

detaileddescription.para: Save pixels to an image. The implementing data reader is responsible for handling format detection, conversion, etc.

briefdescription.para: Return the sample list of current minibatch.
Allow read-only access to the entire sample list.

detaileddescription.para: Returns idx-th sample in the initial loading order. The second argument is only to facilitate overloading, and not to be used by users.

briefdescription.para: Set the default values for the width, the height, the number of channels, and the number of labels of an image.

memberdef.argsstring: (Mat &Y, int data_id, int mb_idx, int tid) override
memberdef.name: fetch_label

detaileddescription.para:
Fetch a single label into a matrix.
Y
The matrix to load data into.
data_id
The index of the datum to fetch.
mb_idx
The index within the mini-batch.
